Name.label: Anterior segment developmental anomaly without extraocular manifestations

TextSection.Contents: A rare, congenital, ocular defect caused by anterior segment dysgenesis and characterized by anteriorly displaced Schwalbe's line and iris bands extending into the cornea. In contrast, Rieger's anomaly includes characteristic iris and pupil anomalies.

Name.label: NTBT (narrower term maps to a broader term)
